title: P5 Terminal Battery
content:
P5 Terminal Battery

P5 Terminal Battery

Last edited time@August 27, 2024 3:26 PM
üÜïCOMING SOON

Summary

On some older terminals, the battery can stop taking a charge if it is repeatedly drained to 0%. In these scenarios, the terminal is usually otherwise undamaged and just needs a working battery.

Check the Warranty

Generally, our hardware warranty covers any replacements or repairs for up to 6 months from the purchase date. If the issue occurs within that time period and needs to be replaced then we can do so free of charge. If not then the merchant will have to purchase it at full price.

Physically Inspect Battery

Before placing an order for a new battery, please visually inspect the charging port to see if appears to be intact. Sometimes the charging port can become loose over time if handled too roughly. If this is the case, the entire terminal will need to be replaced and the normal RMA procedure should be followed.

If the charging port and the rest of the terminal appears undamaged then a full RMA is not needed and we can just order a new battery.

Ordering New Batteries

Battery Price

If a merchant needs to purchase a new battery outside of the warranty period, the retail price is $40 USD and $54 CAD.

SFDC Ordering Process

Ordering new batteries is the same process as ordering new P5 terminals. The instructions for placing orders through SFDC can be found here.

üí°NOTE: The instructions above are for XBU. Other Brands may have a slightly different process for ordering hardware.

Battery Disposal

For faulty batteries, we do not require them to be returned. Instruct the merchants to remove the battery and recycle it at a local certified e-waste facility. The merchant should follow local regulations for proper disposal.
summary: The P5 Terminal Battery documentation outlines procedures for addressing battery issues in older terminals, emphasizing the importance of checking the warranty, which covers replacements or repairs within six months of purchase. It advises inspecting the charging port for damage before ordering a new battery, which costs $40 USD or $54 CAD if outside the warranty period, and provides guidance on the ordering process through SFDC. Additionally, it instructs merchants to recycle faulty batteries at certified e-waste facilities, adhering to local disposal regulations.

Rain Retail SubsidiariesQuilt P5 TerminalPlacing a New Order Important Notice!Shipping InformationOrder InformationBilling InformationChecking Your OrderTracking a P5 shipmentAdyen S1F2 Terminal Placing an S1F2 orderPOS Nation SubsidiariesTAKU SubsidiariesReturns/Replacements

Quilt P5 Terminal

P5 terminals are housed and fulfilled internally by our POS Nation team. For this reason, terminals can be ordered through SFDC and tracking information is available on the case after it‚Äôs been shipped.

Placing a New Order

To place a new terminal order, an SFDC opportunity must first be created. If you‚Äôre unfamiliar with how to do this, please speak with a supervisor.

If you are adding additional hardware to an existing order then the original opportunity may be used. If no opportunity exists then a new one must be created.

Once an opportunity has been created, click into it and there should be a button in the top-right corner that says ‚ÄòOrder Fulfillment‚Äô. This is where you will order new hardware.

Important Notice!

‚ö†Ô∏èWe have discovered that a small percentage of our P5 terminals in the field have a hardware issue which makes them incompatible with our charging cradles and docks. Aside from not working with these accessories, there is no other impact to the P5‚Äôs usage.

These affected P5‚Äôs can be easily identified by looking for a ‚Äò2324‚Äô in the serial number.

BEFORE placing an order for a cradle or dock, please check their payment portal to see if they have the affected serial numbers. If so, then you will need to create an order for the cradle or dock and then create a separate RMA case for the P5‚Äôs.

Shipping Information

Make sure all the information populated is correct and fill in any missing fields. If there are multiple shipping address (such as for a multi-location business) check the box- you will then be prompted to enter the additional addresses.

üí°Note: The address in SFDC may not always be correct, please check with the merchant before entering the shipping address.

Order Information

This page should pull what‚Äôs included on the Opportunity however sometimes accessories and additional units may need to be ordered after the fact. Please check to make sure that the case includes all terminals and accessories needed for this order.

If you are unfamiliar with what each item is or how much they cost, you can review those details here:

  • P5 Credit Card Reader
  • P5 Ethernet Cradle
  • P5 Dock
  • P5 Terminal Battery
üí°Note: There may not be an even number of terminals and accessories (ex. 3 P5‚Äôs but only 1 Ethernet Cradle). Make sure you fill out the quantity needed for each item.

Billing Information

Most of the time, the billing details should already be part of the opportunity you‚Äôre creating this hardware order under however if item(s) need to be added after the fact or billing needs to be adjusted, please list those details here. If a price has not been entered in the Opportunity, please enter it here.

Checking Your Order

Once an order has been placed, you can review it by going back to the Opportunity and clicking on ‚ÄòCases‚Äô under the Related List Quick Links section to find the new case you just created.

Under the ‚ÄòFulfillment Information‚Äô section you can view order details such as the serial numbers, tracking ID, and when it shipped, among other details.

Tracking a P5 shipment

  1. To track an order that has already been created, go to the related SFDC opportunity.
  1. Under ‚ÄòRelated List Quick Links‚Äô click on the Cases link and find the one labeled ‚ÄòHardware Order Fulfillment‚Äô.
  1. On the left-hand side, you should see recent activity. On the right-hand side, you should see Billing and Fulfillment details. Under the ‚ÄòFulfillment Information‚Äô tab, you should find the Tracking ID once it has been shipped. If the field is empty, scroll up to ‚ÄòCase Information‚Äô and look at the status.
    1. If the status says ‚ÄòOrdered‚Äô it means the case has been assigned to our fulfillment team but not yet actually shipped.
    1. If the status says Shipped, Billed, or Closed it means the case has been shipped and should have a Tracking ID. If not, please check with a supervisor.

Placing an S1F2 order

  1. To place an Adyen S1F2 terminal order, an SFDC opportunity quote must first be created. If you‚Äôre unfamiliar with how to do this, please speak with a supervisor.

  1. Under the ‚ÄòSubject‚Äô field, select the ‚ÄòRain Payments Hardware Order‚Äô option.
    1. Fill out the form with the appropriate information and assign the case to yourself.
  1. Once the case is created, click the drop-down arrow next to the task and select the Edit button.
  1. From there enter the following information:
    1. Contact Name
    1. Shipping Address

    1. Make/Model of terminal (ex. Stripe WisePOS E)

Please refer to your existing hardware ordering processes.

title: No, the terminal does not turn on
content:
No, the terminal does not turn on

No, the terminal does not turn on

Last edited time@August 27, 2024 11:54 AM
VerificationExpired

Charging - Best Practices

  1. Make sure the terminal is charged for at least 30 minutes before you start using it.
  1. Always charge the terminal using an outlet or the optional ethernet dock where applicable. Do NOT use a laptop port or other USB port for charging.
  1. Check to make sure the charging icon is visible on the screen. This should look like a battery icon with a lightening bolt in it. Sometimes the charging cable can become loose so always verify the device shows it‚Äôs charging before proceeding.

Troubleshooting Steps

  1. Make sure the supplied power cord and wall adapter are used and not a third-party charger.
  1. Make sure the power cord is plugged directly into a wall outlet (not a computer or USB port).
  1. Make sure that the power cord is plugged in, and charge the terminal for at least 30 minutes.
  1. Hold the Power button on the side of the terminal for 3 seconds before releasing.
  1. Take off the back, remove the battery pack, wait 3 seconds, reinsert the battery pack. Replace back cover. Repeat step 4.

Charge Overnight

  1. If the above steps were not successful, try fully charging the device using one of the recommended charging methods. An overnight charge is recommended for a device that has been reported to be problematic.
  1. After charging, have a supervisor check WiseCloud for the battery percentage to confirm it reached 100%.

Battery Replacement

üÜïCOMING SOON

On some older terminals, the battery can stop taking a charge if it is repeatedly is drained to 0%. In these scenarios, the terminal is usually otherwise undamaged and just needs a working battery. If this is the case, please visually inspect the charging port to see if appears to be intact. Sometimes the charging port can become loose over time if handled too roughly. If this is the case, the entire terminal will need to be replaced and the normal RMA procedure should be followed.

If the charging port and the rest of the terminal appears undamaged then a full RMA is not needed and we can just replace the battery. Please use the Battery Replacement article to submit a request for a new battery.

If you can't resolve the issue using the steps above, refer to the RMA article to get the process started for a replacement/return.
summary: This technical documentation provides troubleshooting steps for a terminal that does not turn on, emphasizing the importance of proper charging practices, such as using the supplied power cord and charging for at least 30 minutes. It includes detailed instructions for checking the charging icon, using the correct charging methods, and performing battery-related checks, with guidance on battery replacement if necessary. If issues persist, it advises following the RMA procedure for terminal replacement.

title: Awaiting Connection
content:
Awaiting Connection

Awaiting Connection

Last edited time@November 5, 2024 10:38 AM
üí°Note: This affects only the Quilt P5 terminal

Summary

There are three potential reasons for this error code:

  1. Battery charge is below 15%
  1. Incorrect Date/Time settings
    1. This may include the date/time reverting back to factory settings
  1. The device is already paired
    1. This may also include the app being uninstalled/reinstalled without first unpairing the terminal

Battery Charge

The battery being dead is known to be the most common cause of the awaiting connection issue. If the battery is below 15% a connection can‚Äôt be made successfully until it is charge to over 15%.

Follow the steps to make sure it‚Äôs charging before attempting the connection again.

  1. Make sure the terminal is charged for at least 30 minutes before you start using it.
  1. Always charge the terminal using an outlet or the optional ethernet dock where applicable. Do NOT use a laptop port or other USB port for charging.
  1. Check to make sure the charging icon is visible on the screen. This should look like a battery icon with a lightening bolt in it. Sometimes the charging cable can become loose so always verify the device shows it‚Äôs charging before proceeding.

Incorrect Date/Time settings

An incorrect date or time can prevent the terminal from connecting to the internet properly which can cause the ‚Äúawaiting connection‚Äù screen, incomplete transactions, or other issues. To resolve this, follow the instructions below:

  1. Close the app by tapping the four corners one at a time sequentially (left-bottom, left-top, right-top, right-bottom)
  1. This should bring you to a Config screen. Press the ‚ÄòClose Application‚Äô button
  1. Swipe up from the bottom of the screen towards the top to bring up the app list
  1. Click on Settings
  1. Click on System
  1. Click on Date & time
  1. Uncheck ‚ÄòUse network-provided time‚Äô
  1. Uncheck ‚ÄòUse network-provided time zone‚Äô
  1. Click on Time zone and select the appropriate region and time zone
üí°Note: It must be within 60 seconds of their time zone so have the merchant check that the time on the terminal and the time on their phone matches down to the minute.
  1. Click on the time and input the correct time
  1. Click on the date and input the correct date
üí°Note: The merchant may be tempted to click on the forward arrow to move one month at a time but the merchant can click on the year to quickly scroll to the right year before updating the day or month.
  1. Proceed back and click on the Quilt App to launch

Date/Time Reverting Back

Occasionally the terminal‚Äôs date/time settings may revert back to the factory defaults. If this happens, we need to re-enable the ‚ÄòUse network-provided time‚Äô setting. To do so, please follow the steps below:

  1. Close the app by tapping the four corners one at a time sequentially (left-bottom, left-top, right-top, right-bottom)
  1. This should bring you to a Config screen. Press the ‚ÄòClose Application‚Äô button
  1. Swipe up from the bottom of the screen towards the top to bring up the app list
  1. Click on Settings
  1. Click on System
  1. Click on Date & time
  1. Re-check ‚ÄòUse network-provided time‚Äô
  1. Proceed back and click on the Quilt App to launch

This sometimes occurs due to the different way Wi-Fi networks can be configured.

The device is already paired

If you are trying to pair a terminal that has already been paired to an account, it may prompt this error message. This may happen if you unpaired it from the POS software but it hasn‚Äôt yet updated the Payment Portal or if you‚Äôre trying to pair a terminal that was previously paired to another location.

To identify if this may be the case, follow the steps below:

  1. Identify the serial number of the P5 terminal
  1. Navigate to the Payment Portal
  1. In the top-left corner use the ‚ÄòJump to‚Äô search and paste the serial number
  1. If it says ‚Äòno results‚Äô then it not currently paired and no further action is required
  1. If the search takes you to a merchant‚Äôs account then it is currently paired with another account and the app will need to be closed and then unpaired before continuing.

App Uninstalled/Reinstalled before unpairing

As part of previous troubleshooting steps, if you uninstalled the Quilt app before unpairing the terminal. It is possible for it to get stuck in this ‚Äòawaiting connection‚Äô state. To resolve this error, follow the steps below:

  1. Close the app by tapping the four corners one at a time sequentially (left-bottom, left-top, right-top, right-bottom)
  1. This should bring you to a Config screen. Press the ‚ÄòClose Application‚Äô button
  1. Identify the serial number of the P5 terminal
  1. Navigate to the Payment Portal
  1. In the top-left corner use the ‚ÄòJump to‚Äô search and paste the serial number
  1. Unpair the terminal from the Profile page
  1. Go back to the terminal and clear the storage
  1. Re-Open the Quilt App

Firewall Restrictions

Customers experiencing the 'Stuck on Awaiting Connection' error message on their device may encounter this issue due to firewall restrictions on their network. This prevents the device from establishing a connection to necessary servers and services.

If a customer reports being 'Stuck on Awaiting Connection' and the other troubleshooting steps didn‚Äôt help, and their network employs a firewall, it is crucial to verify that specific URLs are whitelisted. Follow these steps to resolve the issue:

  1. Whitelisting Process:
    1. Access your network's firewall settings or contact your network administrator.
    1. Ensure that the following URLs are added to the whitelist or allowed list. This action permits outgoing and incoming connections to these URLs, bypassing the firewall restrictions that may be causing the connection issue.
    1. wss://provision.quiltpayments.com
    1. wss://terminalservices.quiltpayments.com
  1. Testing Connectivity:
    1. After whitelisting the URLs, instruct the customer to test the application or service again.
    1. Verify if the 'Stuck on Awaiting Connection' error persists. If it does, further troubleshooting may be necessary.
summary: The "Awaiting Connection" documentation addresses troubleshooting steps for resolving connection issues with the Quilt P5 terminal, focusing on three primary causes: low battery charge, incorrect date/time settings, and device pairing conflicts. It provides detailed instructions for ensuring the terminal is adequately charged, correcting date/time settings, and managing device pairing, including steps for resolving issues caused by app reinstallation without unpairing. Additionally, it highlights the importance of whitelisting specific URLs in network firewalls to prevent connection disruptions.

title: ‚ÄòBoot to FFBM‚Äô Error
content:
‚ÄòBoot to FFBM‚Äô Error

‚ÄòBoot to FFBM‚Äô Error

Last edited time@August 23, 2024 10:09 AM

Summary

If you encounter a "Boot to FFBM" message at boot, it typically indicates an issue with the device's firmware or boot process. To resolve this, you can try the following steps:

Power Off/On Again

Sometimes turning a device off/on again can clear the device cache, install pending system updates, and do other magic troubleshooting things. This should always be the first step:

Adyen

P5 Credit Card ReaderS1F2 Credit Card Reader

Stripe

WisePOS E Card Reader

Check ROM is up to date

Sometimes a device can arrive out of date. This may be due to the terminal being shipped from an older shipment or the store receiving a refurbished device. In either case, a supervisor should check that the device has the latest ROM installed (similar to a Windows Update). They can do that here:

WiseCloud Portal

If you can't resolve the issue using the steps above, refer to the RMA article to get the process started for a replacement/return.
summary: The "Boot to FFBM" error typically signifies a problem with a device's firmware or boot process. To address this issue, users should first attempt a power cycle to clear the cache and install pending updates, and ensure the device's ROM is up to date via the WiseCloud Portal. If these steps do not resolve the problem, users are advised to initiate a replacement or return process as outlined in the RMA article.

title: Problem with the battery/charging
content:
Problem with the battery/charging

Problem with the battery/charging

Last edited time@August 27, 2024 11:54 AM
VerificationExpired
Charging - Best PracticesBattery LifeTake out the BatteryReplace the ChargerCharge OvernightBattery Replacement

Charging - Best Practices

  1. Make sure the terminal is charged for at least 30 minutes before you start using it.
  1. Always charge the terminal using an outlet or the optional ethernet dock where applicable. Do NOT use a laptop port or other USB port for charging.
  1. Check to make sure the charging icon is visible on the screen. This should look like a battery icon with a lightening bolt in it. Sometimes the charging cable can become loose so always verify the device shows it‚Äôs charging before proceeding.

Battery Life

Our terminals should last up to 15 hours on a full charge however depending on various conditions, including: screen brightness; frequency of use; temperature; and more, the battery may drain after only 7-8 hours. This is completely normal and should be expected. If the battery is dying faster than that or does not take a charge at all, please consult the steps below.

Take out the Battery

  1. Turn the terminal off
    1. Quilt P5Press and hold the power button the right-hand side of the device for 1 second until an option appears at the top of the screen to restart the device. Press the Power Off button.
    1. Adyen S1F2Press and hold the power button the left-hand side of the device for 1 second until an option appears at the right of the screen to restart the device. Press the Power Off button.
    1. Stripe WisePOS EPress and hold the power button the right-hand side of the device for 1 second until an option appears at the right of the screen to restart the device. Press the Power Off button.
  1. Remove the battery cover from the back of the terminal
  1. Take out the battery
  1. Make sure there is no dust or debris between the battery connector and the terminal
  1. Put the battery back in the terminal
  1. Charge for at least 30 minutes
  1. After charging, press and hold the power button for at least three seconds to restart the terminal

Replace the Charger

If the battery is still not charging, it may sometimes be necessary to replace the charger.

  • The Quilt P5 and the Adyen S1F2 terminals both use USB-C chargers. These can be easily found at most office/electronic stores.
  • The WisePOS E terminal uses a 10W 5V2A (2000mA) AC Power Adapter which can also be found at most office/electronic stores.

Check with the merchant first to see if they have a spare charger lying around. If not, depending on your company policies, we can purchase a new charger for them or reimburse them if they prefer to buy one locally.

Charge Overnight

  1. Fully charge the device using one of the recommended charging methods. An overnight charge is recommended for a device that has been reported to be problematic.
  1. After charging, have a supervisor check WiseCloud for the battery percentage to confirm it reached 100%.

Battery Replacement

üÜïCOMING SOON

On some older terminals, the battery can stop taking a charge if it is repeatedly is drained to 0%. In these scenarios, the terminal is usually otherwise undamaged and just needs a working battery. If this is the case, please visually inspect the charging port to see if appears to be intact. Sometimes the charging port can become loose over time if handled too roughly. If this is the case, the entire terminal will need to be replaced and the normal RMA procedure should be followed.

If the charging port and the rest of the terminal appears undamaged then a full RMA is not needed and we can just replace the battery. Please use the Battery Replacement article to submit a request for a new battery.

If you can't resolve the issue using the steps above, refer to the RMA article to get the process started for a replacement/return.
summary: This documentation provides troubleshooting steps for battery and charging issues with terminals, emphasizing best practices such as ensuring a minimum 30-minute charge before use and using appropriate charging methods like an outlet or ethernet dock. It includes guidance on checking the charging icon, managing battery life, and steps for removing and inspecting the battery. Additionally, it advises on replacing chargers and batteries if issues persist, and outlines the process for handling terminal replacements if necessary.

title: Terminal keeps falling asleep
content:
Terminal keeps falling asleep

Terminal keeps falling asleep

Last edited time@October 16, 2023 12:14 PM

The terminal should have the sleep setting disabled by default. If someone enabled it, or if it came enabled by default, the terminal can miss transaction requests causing incomplete sales or other issues. While having the sleep setting remain off will drain the battery faster, it will also allow it to perform more reliably and should always be turned off for optimal performance.

üí°Note: This affects only the Quilt P5 terminal
  1. Close the app by tapping the four corners one at a time sequentially (left-bottom, left-top, right-top, right-bottom)
  1. This should bring you to a Config screen. Press the ‚ÄòClose Application‚Äô button
  1. Swipe up from the bottom of the screen towards the top to bring up the app list
  1. Click on Settings
  1. Click on Display
  1. Click on Screen timeout
  1. Change to ‚ÄòNever‚Äô

Then proceed back and click on the Quilt App

If you can't resolve the issue using the steps above, refer to the RMA article to get the process started for a replacement/return.
summary: The documentation addresses an issue with the Quilt P5 terminal where the sleep setting, if enabled, can cause missed transaction requests and incomplete sales. To ensure optimal performance, users should disable the sleep setting by navigating through the terminal's settings to set the screen timeout to 'Never.' If these steps do not resolve the issue, users are advised to consult the RMA process for a replacement or return.

title: WisePOS E Credit Card Reader
content:
WisePOS E Credit Card Reader

WisePOS E Credit Card Reader

Last edited time@July 24, 2023 4:19 PM
IntroductionSupport and FeaturesSupported CountriesSupported Payment MethodsFeaturesLoad/Replace Receipt PaperPower On/Off the TerminalConnect to InternetWi-FiEthernetOpen the ApplicationPair the Terminal

Introduction

The Adyen S1F2 terminal is a wireless countertop terminal for Quilt subsidiaries. This state-of-the-art card reader accepts chip, contactless NFC, or swipe and the attached thermal receipt printer makes taking transactions easier than ever.

Our credit card readers are plug-and-play; Simply connect it to a local Wi-Fi network, enter the pairing code, and start taking payments in minutes.

The S1F2 device is also low-maintenance with no additional upkeep required. Updates happen automatically using the Wi-Fi network with no interruptions and no hassle.

The terminal retails for $400 USD and $450 CAD though prices may vary so check with a supervisor for more detailed information.

To view the terminal‚Äôs parts and features, see the Castle S1F2 product sheet.

üí°Note: This terminal only works for Merchants using Adyen. For Merchants on Stripe, they must use the WisePOS E terminal.

Support and Features

Supported Countries

  • üá∫üá∏ United States - USD
  • üá®üá¶ Canada - CAD

Supported Payment Methods

  • PIN Debit
  • Interac
  • Visa, Mastercard, Discover, American Express, Diners Club

Features

  • Contactless Payments
  • EMV Enabled (Chip Cards)
  • Touchscreen
  • Wi-Fi connection
  • USB-C charging with 15 hour battery life
  • 1-year limited warranty
  • Thermal receipt printer

Load/Replace Receipt Paper

To load or replace the paper in the P5 terminal, grasp the cap (the top of the device with the Contactless icon) of the device on either side from the end and pull up away from paper output.

Next load the receipt paper face-down with the paper coming feeding out from the bottom.

Once the paper is loaded, close the lid and snap it into place.

üí°Note: If the paper prints blank then swap the direction of the paper.

Power On/Off the Terminal

When the merchant first receives the device, it should come partially powered up. Use the USB-C wall charger to begin charging the device to full power.

Once charged for at least 30 minutes, hold down the power button on the right hand side until the screen turns on. Once the device is powered on, pressing the power button once will sleep/wake the device. To fully power off the device hold down the power button until the ‚ÄòPower Off‚Äô option is shown on the screen, then select it.

If you need to replace the battery, lift up from the indentation at the bottom-center of the back cover to detach it from the device.

üí°Note: Ideally the terminal should be powered off each evening and powered on each morning to receive automatic software updates.

Connect to Internet

The terminal must be connected to the internet before it can be paired or updated. For best performance, it should be connected to the same network as the point-of-sale computer.

Wi-Fi

  • Once the device is powered on, unlock the device by using your finger to swipe from the bottom of the screen to the top of the screen
  • Once on the Home screen, repeat this process by swiping up again to show the device applications
  • Click on the ‚ÄòSettings‚Äô app and navigate to ‚ÄòNetwork & Internet‚Äô
  • Select the WiFi network and enter your network details
üí°Note: The Wi-Fi network must use WPA-Personal or WPA2-Personal encryption and be password protected. WiFi is not supported for non-password-protected networks or enterprise networks.

Ethernet

USB-C to Ethernet adapters may be purchased separately to use with an ethernet connection if Wi-Fi is not available.

  • Once the device is powered on, unlock the device by using your finger to swipe from the bottom of the screen to the top of the screen
  • Once on the Home screen, repeat this process by swiping up again to show the device applications
  • Click on the ‚ÄòSettings‚Äô app and navigate to ‚ÄòNetwork & Internet‚Äô
  • At the top of the screen, press the ‚ÄòEthernet‚Äô button
  • Turn the button ON to enable it
  • Then press the central circle button at the bottom of the screen to exit the ‚ÄòSettings‚Äô page

Open the Application

On some older versions of the P5 terminal, the Quilt PayFac application may not open by default and must be clicked on like an app on a smart phone.

  • Once the device is powered on, unlock the device by using your finger to swipe from the bottom of the screen to the top of the screen
  • Once on the Home screen, repeat this process by swiping up again to show the device applications
  • There you should see an app called ‚ÄòQuilt P5‚Äô
  • Click on that app to launch it

Pair the Terminal

  • Once the device is powered up and connected to Wi-Fi for the first time, it should display a three-word pairing code.
  • If you are pairing the P5 terminal for a Merchant using the Rain Retail, LikeSew, Music360, or Jewel360 software then please ignore the instructions below and skip to the Rain Retail Pairing Instructions section.
  • To pair the terminal the Merchant should log into the Payment Portal and click on ‚ÄòAccount‚Äô > Profile in the top-right hand corner
üí°Note: If you are pairing the terminal for the Merchant, you will need to switch into their account from the Merchant List page.
  • Scroll down to ‚ÄòTerminals‚Äô and click ‚Äò+ Add Terminal‚Äô
  • Select P5 from the list and enter the name and Pairing Code
üí°Note: Capitalization is not required but the code should include a hyphen between each word (ex: Pink-Elephant-Test)
  • Click the blue ‚ÄòSave‚Äô button to complete the setup

  • Rain Retail Pairing Instructions
    • To pair a P5 terminal for Rain, the Merchant should log into the Rain software
    • Go to the Admin button in the upper right (your username) and click Settings > Integrations > Rain Processing > Hardware > Add New.¬† Type the three-word activation code displayed on your P5 device.
    • Once the Pairing Code is entered, select the Location and Till that will use this device. If you only have one Till, it will be selected automatically
    • Click on the green ‚ÄòSave‚Äô button to complete the setup
summary: The WisePOS E Credit Card Reader is a wireless countertop terminal designed for easy payment processing, supporting chip, contactless NFC, and swipe transactions, with an integrated thermal receipt printer. It is a plug-and-play device that connects via Wi-Fi and requires minimal maintenance, with automatic updates. The terminal supports various payment methods, including Visa, Mastercard, and American Express, and is available in the United States and Canada, retailing for $400 USD and $450 CAD.

title: Can‚Äôt process transactions
content:
Can‚Äôt process transactions

Can‚Äôt process transactions

Last edited time@October 16, 2023 12:14 PM
Basic TroubleshootingSummaryTransactions never making it to the terminalUnpair/Repair the TerminalCheck ROM is up to dateCheck App is up to dateTransactions receiving an error messageTransaction MinimumsSupported Payments MethodsHigh Risk Transactions

Basic Troubleshooting

Before doing anything, the following steps should be followed:

Basic Hardware Troubleshooting

Once completed, please move onto the steps below.

Summary

There are three distinct issues that may result in transactions not being processed:

  • Transactions never making it to the point-of-sale
  • Transactions receiving an error message
  • High risk transactions

Transactions never making it to the terminal

Sometimes transactions started from the point-of-sale may not reach the terminal. The most likely reason for this is that the device was not paired correctly or lost connection with the internet or point-of-sale.

Unpair/Repair the Terminal

If you‚Äôve already completed the Basic Troubleshooting steps then the next step would be to unpair the terminal and repair it. You can see how to do this below:

Pairing/Unpairing Terminals

Check ROM is up to date

Sometimes a device can arrive out of date. This may be due to the terminal being shipped from an older shipment or the store receiving a refurbished device. In either case, a supervisor should check that the device has the latest ROM installed (similar to a Windows Update). They can do that here:

WiseCloud Portal

Check App is up to date

Sometimes a device can arrive out of date. This may be due to the terminal being shipped from an older shipment or the store receiving a refurbished device. In either case, a supervisor should check that the device has the latest app version installed. They can do that here:

WiseCloud Portal

Transactions receiving an error message

If the terminal or point-of-sale receives an error message it should outline the issue but below are the most common issues.

Transaction Minimums

We require a minimum of $0.50 per transaction with both Stripe and Adyen. There are several reasons for this but at the very least, it‚Äôs in the merchant‚Äôs best interest to process transactions over that amount since most stores will pay a minimum of $0.11 per transaction plus other built-in costs like rent, salary, utilities, etc would mean anything less and they‚Äôd lose money on that sale.

If the amount they are trying to process is less than $0.50 they will have to process an amount more than that for it to go through.

Supported Payments Methods

We support most major payment methods however some card types we may not currently support or may be in development. If one of these cards attempted to process a transaction, it would not work. Here are a list of the most common payment methods we do NOT support which will throw an error:

  • UnionPay, also known as China UnionPay or by its abbreviation, CUP
  • Generic (non-branded) gift cards. Essentially gift cards without the VISA, Mastercard, etc logo on it.
  • EBT/eWIC

High Risk Transactions

Occasionally we will identify a card or transaction as ‚Äúhigh-risk‚Äù. This can be determined by a variety of factors such as recent transaction history, chargeback reports, IP address, and more. In these situations the merchant may even know the customer in question however it is still not advisable to accept the transaction. If the risk level is too high, we will have no way to accept the payment even if the merchant wanted us to.

When this happens we will attempt to reach out to the merchant via email notifying them of the situation and offering potential solutions.

If you can't resolve the issue using the steps above, refer to the RMA article to get the process started for a replacement/return.
summary: The documentation provides troubleshooting steps for resolving issues with transaction processing, focusing on three main problems: transactions not reaching the terminal, transactions receiving error messages, and high-risk transactions. It advises users to ensure devices are properly paired, and that both ROM and app versions are up to date, while also highlighting the importance of transaction minimums and supported payment methods. For high-risk transactions, it suggests merchants may be notified via email, and if issues persist, users are directed to initiate a replacement or return process.

title: Can‚Äôt pair the terminal to software
content:
Can‚Äôt pair the terminal to software

Can‚Äôt pair the terminal to software

Last edited time@June 26, 2024 4:02 PM
SummaryNot Displaying a Pairing Code1. Check the Battery Life2. Power Off/On AgainQuilt P5Adyen S1F2Stripe WisePOS E3. Unpaired the Terminal & now Can‚Äôt Re-Pair ItQuilt P5Stripe WisePOS E4. ‚ÄúAwaiting Connection‚Äù MessagePairing Code not WorkingMake Sure it‚Äôs the Right DeviceIt‚Äôs Showing the Same Pairing CodeQuilt P5Unpair the P5 TerminalRain Unpairing InstructionsBe sure to include hyphens (Stripe)Make sure spelling/formatting is correct (Stripe)

Summary

Sometimes a terminal won‚Äôt connect to the software. Most of the time, this is an easy fix and should only take a few minutes to resolve.

Not Displaying a Pairing Code

Occasionally a terminal may get stuck in a state where the pairing code can‚Äôt be displayed.

1. Check the Battery Life

Make sure the battery is over 20%. Battery life can affect many functions of the device, including receiving important updates and generating a pairing code.

2. Power Off/On Again

Sometimes turning a device off/on again can clear the device cache, install pending system updates, and do other magic troubleshooting things. This should always be the first step.

Quilt P5

Press and hold the power button the right-hand side of the device for 1 second until an option appears at the top of the screen to restart the device. Press the Restart button.

Adyen S1F2

Press and hold the power button the left-hand side of the device for 1 second until an option appears at the right of the screen to restart the device. Press the Restart button.

Stripe WisePOS E

Press and hold the power button the right-hand side of the device for 1 second until an option appears at the right of the screen to restart the device. Press the Restart button.

3. Unpaired the Terminal & now Can‚Äôt Re-Pair It

It is not uncommon for the terminal to be paired to a different account. So if you have gone through standard unpairing steps, it is important to make sure the terminal isn‚Äôt paired to another account.

Quilt P5

If the terminal won‚Äôt generate a new pairing code, clearing the storage on the device should resolve it.

Stripe WisePOS E

If you‚Äôre working with a WisePOS E terminal, you can generate a new pairing code.

4. ‚ÄúAwaiting Connection‚Äù Message

üí°Note: This applies only to the P5 terminal.

Sometimes the terminal can get stuck in an ‚Äúawaiting connection‚Äù state. The most common cause of this is that the device is not connected to the internet. Check the connection and make sure it‚Äôs connected to the internet to resolve.

If this happens, clearing the storage on the device should resolve it.

Pairing Code not Working

Make Sure it‚Äôs the Right Device

Check with the customer to make sure they are pairing the correct terminal. Occasional mistakes can happen which result the in the wrong device(s) being shipped. If the merchant is processing with our PayFac using Adyen they should be using the S1F2 or the P5 terminals. If they merchant is processing with our PayFac using Stripe then they should be using the WisePOS E terminal.

It‚Äôs Showing the Same Pairing Code

Sometimes the device can get in a state where the POS software thinks that the terminal has been paired. In these cases, it may even show up in the list as paired however the terminal will still show the same pairing code as if it wasn‚Äôt accepted.

This can result in the POS trying to send a transaction to the device but the terminal not responding. In these cases, we need to unpair the phantom terminal and repair it.

Quilt P5

If the terminal won‚Äôt generate a new pairing code, clearing the storage on the device should resolve it.

Unpair the P5 Terminal

  1. Log into the Payment Portal and use the Merchant List page to find the affected store and click on the ‚ÄòSwitch Account‚Äô button
  1. Go to Account > Profile
  1. Scroll down to the ‚ÄòTerminals‚Äô section and click on the red trash can icon
Rain Unpairing Instructions

If the merchant is using the Rain Retail software then the terminal can be unpaired from the POS software by:

  1. Click on the user > Settings
  1. Integrations > Rain Payments
  1. Scroll down to the ‚ÄòTerminals‚Äô section and click on the gray trash can icon

Once the device has been unpaired it should generate a new pairing code. If it doesn‚Äôt, clearing the storage on the device should resolve it.

If you‚Äôre working with a WisePOS E terminal, you can generate a new pairing code.

Be sure to include hyphens (Stripe)

The Stripe WisePOS E terminals are paired using a three word code separated by hyphens (-). If the hyphens are missing, the pairing code won‚Äôt work.

P5 Pairing Screen example

Make sure spelling/formatting is correct (Stripe)

Since the words are generated randomly, there is a possibility that the pairing code may be longer or spelled in an unfamiliar fashion. The likelihood that the correct pairing code is being entered and not being accepted is very small so we should always check to make sure they are spelling each word correctly and are avoid spaces or special characters. Capitalization doesn‚Äôt affect anything.

If you can't resolve the issue using the steps above, refer to the RMA article to get the process started for a replacement/return.
summary: The documentation provides troubleshooting steps for resolving issues with pairing terminals to software, focusing on common problems such as the terminal not displaying a pairing code, being stuck in an "awaiting connection" state, or showing the same pairing code repeatedly. Key solutions include checking the battery life, restarting the device, ensuring the terminal is not paired to another account, and verifying the correct device and pairing code format. If issues persist, users are advised to clear the device's storage or refer to the RMA process for replacement or return.

title: Quilt P5 App is Missing
content:
Quilt P5 App is Missing

Quilt P5 App is Missing

Last edited time@October 16, 2023 12:14 PM
üí°Note: This page references ONLY the P5 terminal.

In some rare cases, the Quilt App may be missing from the terminal. When this occurs a few things should be checked prior to diagnose the problem.

  1. Confirm the app is missing
    1. The Quilt P5 App should load by default however in some cases, this may not always be the case. If the terminal does not immediately load after powering on, use your finger to slide up from the bottom of the screen towards the top like you would on a smart phone.
    1. This should display all the applications on the device. If the app is missing then it should only show:
      1. Camera
      1. File Manager
      1. Gallery
      1. Settings
    1. Otherwise the app should be called ‚ÄúQuilt P5 Terminal‚Äù and should be listed next to the other apps. If you see this then have the merchant click on it to start.
  1. If you‚Äôve done Step 1 and confirmed the app is missing then a supervisor should check WiseCloud to see if the app is installed. From here, they should be able to install the app remotely if the terminal is powered on and connected to Wi-Fi.
  1. If you‚Äôve done Step 1 and a supervisor is unavailable then a Ticket should be created for our PayFac team who can install the app remotely if the terminal is powered on and connected to Wi-Fi.

If you can't resolve the issue using the steps above, refer to the RMA article to get the process started for a replacement/return.
summary: The Quilt P5 App may occasionally be missing from the terminal, and users should first confirm its absence by checking the list of installed applications. If the app is indeed missing, a supervisor can install it remotely via the WiseCloud portal, or a ticket can be created for the PayFac team to handle the installation if a supervisor is unavailable. If these steps do not resolve the issue, users should refer to the RMA process for a replacement or return.

title: Yes, they‚Äôre using Wi-Fi
content:
Yes, they‚Äôre using Wi-Fi

Yes, they‚Äôre using Wi-Fi

Last edited time@March 27, 2024 4:38 PM
SummaryBasic Troubleshooting1. Check Correct Wi-Fi Settings2. Power Off/On AgainQuilt P5Adyen S1F2Stripe WisePOS E3. Turn Wi-Fi Off/On AgainQuilt P5Adyen S1F2Stripe WisePOS E4. Move the TerminalAdvanced Troubleshooting (Supervisors)1. Cloudflare DNS Setup2. Check ROM is up to date3. Check App is up to date4. Connect to Ethernet

Summary

There are many things that can affect the Wi-Fi connection of a terminal. Use the section below to complete basic troubleshooting before moving on to more advanced steps.

Basic Troubleshooting

1. Check Correct Wi-Fi Settings

Our terminals have certain Wi-Fi requirements in order to remain secure and PCI Compliant. Please make sure the device is connected to a network that meets the following conditions:

  1. Wi-Fi network must use WPA-Personal or WPA2-Personal encryption and be password protected. Wi-Fi is not supported for non-password-protected networks or enterprise networks.
  1. Choose the correct Wi-Fi frequency (2.4 GHz or 5 GHz)

    A 2.4 GHz connection travels farther at lower speeds, while 5 GHz frequencies provide faster speeds at shorter range. Your choice of 2.4 GHz or 5 GHz will depend on where and how the merchant uses their Wi-Fi connection the most.

    A lot of electronic devices and appliances use the 2.4 GHz frequency, including microwaves, baby monitors, security cameras, and garage door openers. If the has many of these in their place of business, or they work in an office space where nearby devices could be interfering, that 2.4 GHz band is likely to be congested, which can damage speed and signal quality.

  1. Make sure the battery is over 20%. Battery life can affect many functions of the device, including Wi-Fi connection.
  1. Make sure the computer and terminal are connected to the same network. For security purposes, the register computer and the terminal must be connected to the same Wi-Fi network.
    1. The Stripe WisePOS E terminal has stricter settings and requires the terminal and the register computer to be on the same type of network so if the computer is on an ethernet connection then the terminal must also be on an ethernet connection.

2. Power Off/On Again

Sometimes turning a device off/on again can clear the device cache, install pending system updates, and do other magic troubleshooting things. This should always be the first step.

Quilt P5

Press and hold the power button the right-hand side of the device for 1 second until an option appears at the top of the screen to restart the device. Press the Restart button.

Adyen S1F2

Press and hold the power button the left-hand side of the device for 1 second until an option appears at the right of the screen to restart the device. Press the Restart button.

Stripe WisePOS E

Press and hold the power button the right-hand side of the device for 1 second until an option appears at the right of the screen to restart the device. Press the Restart button.

3. Turn Wi-Fi Off/On Again

Quilt P5

  1. Closing the app by tapping the four corners one at a time and then swiping up
  1. Swipe up from the bottom of the screen towards the top to bring up the app list
  1. Click on Settings
  1. Click on Network & internet
  1. Click on Wi-Fi
  1. Click on the connected network
  1. Click on the Forget icon at the top-left of the screen

Then proceed to connect to Wi-Fi again

Adyen S1F2

  1. Press the gear icon on the bottom-left of the screen to open the Settings page
  1. Click on ‚ÄòNetwork‚Äô and enter the PIN 3191 to proceed
  1. Click on Wi-Fi
  1. Click on the ‚ÄòForget‚Äô icon at the top of the screen

Then proceed to connect to Wi-Fi again.

Stripe WisePOS E

  1. Swipe from the left side of the screen to the right
  1. Click on Settings
  1. Enter the PIN 07139 to proceed
  1. Click on Network
  1. Click on the Wi-Fi network you‚Äôre troubleshooting
  1. Re-enter the Wi-Fi network password
  1. Click on the Wi-Fi network you‚Äôre troubleshooting again
  1. Click on the ‚ÄòForget network‚Äô button

Then proceed to connect to Wi-Fi again

4. Move the Terminal

Environmental factors may impact Wi-Fi performance such as:

  • Microwaves
  • Concrete walls
  • Distance from wireless router or AP

Check with the merchant to see if the router or terminal can be moved. If moving the router or terminal helps maintain a steady connection then, if possible, it may be worth relocating one or both of them permanently. See the section on Wi-Fi Frequency for more information.

If the above steps have been followed and the terminal is still not connecting reliably, a supervisor should step in and attempt the following.

Advanced Troubleshooting (Supervisors)

If internet issues persist or if the above steps do not work, the following should be done by a supervisor:

1. Cloudflare DNS Setup

Cloudflare DNS can be very helpful with devices that can‚Äôt connect, or stay connected, to the local Wi-Fi network. Click on the following article to go through the Cloudflare DNS Setup.

2. Check ROM is up to date

Sometimes a device can arrive out of date. This may be due to the terminal being shipped from an older shipment or the store receiving a refurbished device. In either case, a supervisor should check that the device has the latest ROM installed (similar to a Windows Update). They can do that here:

WiseCloud Portal

3. Check App is up to date

Sometimes a device can arrive out of date. This may be due to the terminal being shipped from an older shipment or the store receiving a refurbished device. In either case, a supervisor should check that the device has the latest app version installed. They can do that here:

WiseCloud Portal

4. Connect to Ethernet

Both the Quilt P5 and the Stripe WisePOS E terminals have Ethernet capabilities. If the merchant is having an unstable connection or can‚Äôt connect to the local Wi-Fi network, their best option may be to purchase an ethernet adapter separately which should provide a more steady, reliable connection.

  • Quilt P5 Ethernet Instructions
  • Stripe WisePOS E Ethernet Instructions
summary: This technical documentation provides troubleshooting steps for resolving Wi-Fi connectivity issues with payment terminals. It outlines basic troubleshooting methods, such as verifying Wi-Fi settings, ensuring devices are on the same network, and restarting devices, as well as advanced steps for supervisors, including setting up Cloudflare DNS and checking for software updates. The document emphasizes the importance of using secure Wi-Fi networks and addresses potential environmental factors that may impact connectivity.

title: No, they‚Äôre not using Wi-Fi
content:
No, they‚Äôre not using Wi-Fi

No, they‚Äôre not using Wi-Fi

Last edited time@June 18, 2024 2:36 PM
SummaryRun Internet Speed testCheck the Ethernet Port on the RouterCheck ROM is up to date (Supervisor)Check App is up to date (Supervisor)Check Ethernet AdapterQuilt P5Stripe WisePOS EReplace Ethernet CableContact Local IT

Summary

If a merchant is experiencing internet issues while using an ethernet connection there‚Äôs not a lot of additional troubleshooting we can do and the most likely problem is their network. With that said, the following are helpful tips to diagnose the issue.

Run Internet Speed test

Use Google or another service to run an internet speed speed. The minimum required speeds should be at least 25 Mbps of download speed and 3 Mbps of upload speed. That bandwidth should accommodate anywhere between two to seven devices simultaneously.

Check the Ethernet Port on the Router

Sometimes a router can have a broken, loose, or malfunctioning ethernet port. Try having the merchant unplug the ethernet cable and plug it into another port on their router.

Check ROM is up to date (Supervisor)

Sometimes a device can arrive out of date. This may be due to the terminal being shipped from an older shipment or the store receiving a refurbished device. In either case, a supervisor should check that the device has the latest ROM installed (similar to a Windows Update). They can do that here:

WiseCloud Portal

Check App is up to date (Supervisor)

Sometimes a device can arrive out of date. This may be due to the terminal being shipped from an older shipment or the store receiving a refurbished device. In either case, a supervisor should check that the device has the latest app version installed. They can do that here:

WiseCloud Portal

Check Ethernet Adapter

Only ethernet adapters recommended by us should be used with our terminals. If they are using another device, it could have issues with speed or consistency.

Quilt P5

We support a custom Ethernet Cradle. Only this should be used whenever possible.

üí°Note: The cradle has a very snug fit to avoid the P5 from coming loose. If ethernet is not working, please press down firmly to make sure it‚Äôs all the way in the cradle housing.

Stripe WisePOS E

Stripe has a dock available that supports ethernet. They should only use the one purchased from us to guarantee support.

Replace Ethernet Cable

  • Older Cat3 cables could be limiting speeds to only 10MBPS, a rate that may have worked back in the day but is completely unusable now. Replacing that with a new Cat5 cable should provide immediate increases to speed and reliability.
  • The ethernet cable could also be damaged or not connected properly. Have them check for any exposed wires or loose caps.

Contact Local IT

If the network was setup my a local IT group, they may have configured things in such a way that makes things more difficult when adding new secure devices. In this case, they should be contacted to come out and help whitelist the device.

If you can't resolve the issue using the steps above, refer to the RMA article to get the process started for a replacement/return.
summary: The documentation provides troubleshooting steps for merchants experiencing internet issues with an ethernet connection, emphasizing that the likely cause is a network problem. Key recommendations include running an internet speed test to ensure minimum speeds of 25 Mbps download and 3 Mbps upload, checking the router's ethernet port, ensuring devices have the latest ROM and app updates, using recommended ethernet adapters, and replacing outdated or damaged ethernet cables. If issues persist, contacting local IT for network configuration assistance or initiating a replacement process may be necessary.

title: Cloudflare DNS Setup
content:
Cloudflare DNS Setup

Cloudflare DNS Setup

Last edited time@July 26, 2023 4:47 PM
SummaryCloudflare DNS on WindowsGet to the Network PropertiesSet up DNS for IPv4Set up DNS for IPv6Cloudflare DNS on macOSCloudflare DNS on AndroidCloudflare DNS on iOSStill Having Network Issues

Summary

Network issues can result in the terminal losing connectivity and displaying various errors. Changing these settings on the register computer can help the network and the device talk more easily. None of these settings should have any impact on their current network although it‚Äôs a good idea to take a screenshot of existing settings if they are not currently blank.

Cloudflare DNS on Windows

Get to the Network Properties

  1. Open the Start menu and click on the cog symbol, just above the shutdown button. This will open the Windows Settings system.
  1. Click on Network and Internet to get to the Network Settings page. Click on Change adapter options. This will open a list of network connections.
  1. Right-click on the network you use to connect to the internet and select Properties from the context menu.üí°Note: This process can sometimes be a little different depending on the Windows version. Basically, you just need to get to the Wi-Fi properties page.

Set up DNS for IPv4

  1. In the connection properties window, look to see if the line Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4) is checked. If so, click on that line once and then press the Properties button. This will open another window.
  1. If there are values in the DNS fields, write them down in case you need to rollback to your current settings.
  1. Click on the 'Use the following DNS server addresses' radio button.
  1. Enter 1.1.1.1 in the Preferred DNS server field.
  1. Enter 1.0.0.1 in the Alternate DNS server field.
  1. Click on the OK button and then click on Close in the connection properties window.
  1. Restart your browser to get it to use the Cloudflare DNS service.

Set up DNS for IPv6

  1. If the line Internet Protocol Version 6 (TCP/IPv6) is checked in the connection properties screen, click on the line and press the Properties button. This will open another window.
  1. Note down any current values in the DNS fields if there are any. You may need to return to these settings at a later date.
  1. Click on the Use the following DNS server addresses radio button.
  1. Enter 2606:4700:4700::1111 in the Preferred DNS server field.
  1. Enter 2606:4700:4700::1001 in the Alternate DNS server field.
  1. Click on OK to close the protocol properties window and then press the Close button in the connection properties window.
  1. Restart your browser to get it to use the Cloudflare DNS service.

Cloudflare DNS on macOS

Setting up the Cloudflare DNS on Macs is very straightforward.

  1. Open System Preferences.
  1. Perform a search for DNS Servers. Click on that entry in the results list.
  1. Click on the + symbol to add a new DNS record. Enter 1.1.1.1
  1. Click on the + symbol again and enter 1.0.0.1 this time.
  1. Click on OK and then click Apply.
  1. Restart your browser to get the new DNS settings active.

Cloudflare DNS on Android

At present, Android devices only use IPv4 addresses. You need to be connected to the network that you want to change the DNS settings for.

  1. From the top of the screen, swipe down to get the settings bar to expand. Tap on WiFi. Tap on More Settings at the bottom of the list of available networks.
  1. Long-press on the name of your current network. Tap Modify Network in the popup that appears.
  1. Tap on Advanced options in the next screen and then tap on IP settings and select Static.
  1. Scroll down to the fields DNS1 and DNS2. If these fields have the values in them, note them down in case you want to return to your original settings.
  1. For DNS1 enter 1.1.1.1 and in DNS2 enter 1.0.0.1.
  1. Tap on Save.

Cloudflare DNS on iOS

Just like Android, iOS only uses IPv4 addresses.

  1. Tap Settings in the Home screen. Select Wi-Fi from the Settings screen.
  1. In the Wi-Fi screen tap on the right-arrow next to the name of your internet connection.
  1. Tap Configure DNS and then Manual.
  1. If any DNS entries exist, note them down and then delete them.
  1. Tap + Add Server. Enter 1.1.1.1 for the address value.
  1. Tap + Add Server. Enter 1.0.0.1 for the address value.
  1. Tap Save.

Still Having Network Issues

  1. Hard Refresh.
  1. Clear cache and cookies.
  1. Unplug & plug back in the card terminal power cable.
  1. Unplug & plug back in the wifi router power cable.
  1. Try switching from Wi-Fi to ethernet (or vice versa) when available.
summary: The Cloudflare DNS Setup documentation provides step-by-step instructions for configuring Cloudflare DNS on various operating systems, including Windows, macOS, Android, and iOS, to improve network connectivity and performance. For Windows, it details accessing network properties and setting DNS addresses for both IPv4 and IPv6, while macOS, Android, and iOS setups focus on entering specific DNS server addresses. The document also offers troubleshooting tips for persistent network issues, such as clearing cache and restarting network devices.

title: Tips
content:
Tips

Tips

Last edited time@October 14, 2024 2:55 PM

Summary

Tips is a powerful feature that is available on the all current releases which allows a merchant to collect funds based on a dollar amount or a percentage of the total sale price to be distributed to employees for exceptional service, directly from the terminal.

Availability

Some features, like Tips, are available on the PayFac but may not be available to all Brands. This may be due to additional integration work that might be required and/or other factors such as customer demand, dev priorities, or more. In this case, see the table below for which brands have access to this feature as of this moment.

BrandAvailable
Comcash‚úÖ
LifeSaver‚úÖ
Markt POS‚úÖ
üí°Note: Tips requires additional development to implement. Please have a supervisor speak with your local Product team if you feel this feature may be of interest to your industry or Brand and we can get it enabled.

Processor

BrandAvailable
Adyen‚úÖ
Stripe‚ùå

Enabling Tips

Tips can be enabled for all merchants, it is set to off by default and will need to be enabled. Once enabled, it can be turned ON/OFF on the Profile page for individual clients similar to other features such as PIN Debit or Receipt Printing.

Configuring Tip Options

The options screen will automatically come up as soon as the Enable Tips is turned on, the configuration screen that is pictured can also be launched by clicking the configuration button to the right of the enable toggle.

There are two options for the type of tips that are available, a percentage and whole dollar amount. They are selected through the drop down menu at the top of the configuration screen.

Once the Tipping Type has been selected, the amounts for each tip can be configured. If less Tip options are preferred then pressing the ON/OFF button next to each option will hide that button resulting in fewer choices.

üí°Note: Depending on the integration type, these settings maybe preset by the POS.

Usage

Once enabled, a new prompt will appear at the end of a transaction asking if they‚Äôd like to include a Tip. The information displayed can all be customized.

In addition to the total due and the tip prompts configured above, ‚ÄòCustom and ‚ÄòSkip Tip‚Äô will always appear.

The ‚ÄòCustom‚Äô button allows the customer to enter in a dollar amount they want to tip regardless of the tipping type being set to % Amount or Dollar Amount.

Example

https://prod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/a2eac450-ca50-4632-b656-7d30a3a195b1/6c9b70a0-1775-4099-b9fc-c2d876c44b63/Tips_2_Skip_Tip.mp4
summary: The "Tips" feature allows merchants to collect additional funds as a dollar amount or percentage of the total sale to reward employees for exceptional service, directly through the terminal. It is available on all current releases but requires enabling and configuration, with options for percentage or whole dollar tips, and is supported by brands like Comcash, LifeSaver, and Markt POS. Once enabled, a prompt appears at the end of transactions for customers to add a tip, with customizable options including a 'Custom' button for entering specific amounts.

title: Donations
content:
Donations

Donations

Last edited time@October 31, 2024 11:11 AM

Summary

Donations is a powerful feature which allows a merchant to collect funds on behalf of a non-profit of their choice, directly from the terminal. If the merchant is a non-profit themselves then this can generate hundreds or even thousands in additional revenue each month.

Availability

Some features, like Donations, are available on the PayFac but may not be available to all Brands. This may be due to additional integration work that might be required and/or other factors such as customer demand, dev priorities, or more. In this case, see the table below for which brands have access to this feature as of this moment. If a brand or product is not listed below, then it does not have the ability to do donations.

BrandAvailable
ThriftCart‚úÖ
Jewel360 (ASC)‚úÖ
üí°Note: Donations requires additional development to implement. Please have a supervisor speak with your local Product team if you feel this feature may be of interest to your industry or Brand and we can get it enabled.

Processor

BrandAvailable
Adyen‚úÖ
Stripe*‚úÖ

*Donations is available through Stripe ONLY through ThriftCart and requires the purchase of a 3rd party tablet since the terminal does not display it on the screen.

App Version

Donations is available on all app versions.

Enabling Donations

Donations may not be enabled by default for all merchants. Some brands, like ThriftCart, may have merchants that use it more heavily in which case we can enable it for everyone by default. Once enabled, it can be turned ON/OFF on the Profile page similar to other features such as Tips or Receipt Printing.

The logo, prompt, and donation type can all be customized.

üí°Note: Depending on the integration type, these settings maybe preset by the POS.

Donation Type

There are three different types of donations supported by the P5:

  1. $ Amount
    1. Each donation will appear as a fixed dollar amount.
    1. This allows up to 4 prompts
  1. % Amount
    1. Each donation will appear as a percentage of the transaction amount.
    1. This allows up to 4 prompts
  1. Round Up
    1. The donation amount will round up to the nearest whole dollar
    1. This allows only 1 prompt

Usage

https://prod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/a2eac450-ca50-4632-b656-7d30a3a195b1/ee3dae4d-9b98-469d-a25a-442e04b1b672/Screen_recording_20240419_115430.mp4

Once enabled, a new prompt will appear at the end of a transaction asking if they‚Äôd like to donate. The information displayed can all be customized.

Example
summary: The Donations feature enables merchants to collect funds for non-profits directly through their payment terminals, potentially increasing revenue for non-profit merchants. Availability of this feature varies by brand and requires additional integration work; currently, it is accessible through ThriftCart and Jewel360 (ASC), with processor support from Adyen and Stripe (via ThriftCart with a third-party tablet). Donations can be customized in terms of logo, prompt, and type, offering options like fixed dollar amounts, percentage of transaction, or rounding up to the nearest dollar, and can be enabled or disabled on the merchant's profile page.

title: Standalone Mode
content:
Standalone Mode

Standalone Mode

Last edited time@November 14, 2024 10:35 AM
SummaryAvailabilityProcessorApp VersionEnabling StandaloneTerminal SettingUsage

Summary

The standalone feature allows merchants to process card present payments independently from the POS. Aside from having an active payment processing account enabled, it requires no additional setup and can be used immediately. There are two primary use-cases for this feature:

  • Line Busting/Events: For merchants either at tradeshows or who can see long lines at their location, this allows a clerk to take the terminal and quickly accept payments rather than having to wait for each customer to come to the till, scan every item, etc.
  • Poor Internet Connection: For merchants with spotty or intermittent internet speeds, this can be an ideal solution. Rather than needing to have a laptop, receipt printer, and a credit card terminal all connected to the internet at the same time, the merchant could operate using exclusively our P5 terminal.

Availability

Some features, like Standalone Mode is available on all brands, but it is not enabled by default. Currently the P5 is the only terminal with this option.

üí°Note: Standalone requires NO additional development work to implement. Please have a supervisor speak with your local Product team if you feel this feature may be of interest to your industry or Brand and we can get it enabled.

Processor

BrandAvailable
Adyen (P5 Only)‚úÖ
Stripe‚ùå

App Version

TBD

Enabling Standalone

Once enabled on both the brand features, and the account feature flags, the profile page will indicate that it has been enabled for this account.

Terminal Setting

Once the option has been enabled for the account, the merchant can decide when to start using the Standalone feature. To start using Standalone the merchant will need to follow these steps on each P5 terminal they wish to enable for Standalone operation:

  1. Exit the app using the four corner tap process, by taping the four corners one at a time and then swiping up from the bottom of the screen.
  1. Open the CONFIG tab and locate the Standalone button.
  1. Toggle Standalone Mode to ON by clicking on the ON/OFF button.
  1. Return to the app by pressing the back arrow at the bottom left of the screen.
üí°

NOTE: If the app crashes or the device is turned off/reset, then it will automatically exit the standalone mode. However, the toggle setting remains in the device configuration, so you can re-enable standalone mode. If the standalone toggle does not appear immediately after turning on the device, wait one to two minutes for the terminal to sync its settings, then recheck the device configuration to set the toggle.

Usage

https://prod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/a2eac450-ca50-4632-b656-7d30a3a195b1/2867c612-8cb2-481f-bf27-1cb37700446c/Screen_recording_20241029_210924.mp4

In Standalone mode, the merchant can now enter an amount to charge and an optional transaction ID into the terminal to process transactions. Transactions processed in Standalone mode will not appear in the POS since the terminal will be operating independently from the POS system.

  • The Transaction ID field is displayed on the Payments page in the Payment Portal and can be used by the merchant to record the sales in their POS at a later time. Transactions processed as standalone will be displayed in the Payments Page as ‚Äòstandalone‚Äô which lets the merchant easily distinguish them from other transactions.
  • All standalone transactions will still be charged the Card Present fee.
  • Standalone will also work with other features such as Donations, Tips, and Receipt printing.
  • If the POS sends a transaction to the terminal while it is in Standalone mode, the P5 will come out of Standalone to process the payment like normal, then will return to Standalone mode after the previous transaction is completed.
üí°

NOTE: Refunds are not supported in Standalone mode, since the transactions do not appear in the POS. This means the only way to refund a Standalone transaction is by going to the payment portal and refunding it from the Payments page.

The merchant should be cautious to refund the right transaction and use the transaction details such as the ID and last four of the card to confirm it is the correct payment.
summary: The Standalone Mode feature allows merchants to process card-present payments independently from the POS system using the P5 terminal, ideal for scenarios like line busting at events or locations with poor internet connectivity. This mode requires no additional setup beyond an active payment processing account and can be enabled without development work. Transactions in Standalone Mode are processed independently, do not appear in the POS, and support features like donations and tips, but refunds must be handled through the payment portal.

title: EBT Payments
content:
EBT Payments

EBT Payments

Last edited time@October 29, 2024 2:26 PM
SummaryAvailabilityProcessorPricingDefault RateReportingApp VersionPayout ScheduleEBT FoodEBT CashOnboarding EBT-Eligible MerchantsAccepting EBT TransactionsMixed PaymentEBT Food / CashEBT Balance

Summary

Electronic Benefit Transfer (EBT) is a system used by government welfare programs to distribute benefits to eligible individuals. Instead of paper food stamps or vouchers, EBT allows recipients to access their benefits electronically using a plastic card similar to a credit or debit card.

In a retail space, EBT cards can be used by customers to purchase eligible food items at authorized retailers. When a customer pays with an EBT card, the transaction is processed electronically, deducting the cost of the purchased items from the customer's benefit balance. Retailers must have a point-of-sale (POS) system capable of processing EBT transactions and must comply with regulations regarding eligible items and payment processing.

EBT has two distinct components- EBT Food and EBT Cash.

üí°Note: EBT is only supported on our P5 Terminal. There are currently no plans to support this with other terminals.

Availability

Some features, like EBT, are available on the PayFac but may not be available to all Brands. This may be due to additional integration work that might be required and/or other factors such as customer demand, dev priorities, or more. In this case, see the table below for which brands have access to this feature as of this moment.

BrandAvailable
Atlantic Systems (ASI)‚úÖ
IT Retail (ITR)‚úÖ
Markt POS‚úÖ
üí°Note: EBT requires development work on the POS. Please have a supervisor speak with your local Product team if you feel this feature may be of interest to your industry or Brand.

Processor

BrandAvailable
Adyen‚úÖ
Stripe‚ùå

Pricing

EBT usually has its own pricing structure separate from their normal processing fees. For example, a merchant may sign up with rates of 2.80% + $0.10 and an EBT fee of $0.10. This means if a consumer pays with a Visa, Mastercard, Amex, or Discover card the merchant would pay the 2.80% + $0.10 rate but if the consumer pays with a EBT card, the merchant would only pay $0.10.

The fee can be edited in the normal Transaction Rates section of the Profile page.

Default Rate

The Default Rate is $0.10 but we can price match provided we receive statements.

Reporting

Unlike our other fees, EBT transaction fees are calculated and charged in one lump sum at the end of the month. This means that individual EBT transactions will appear to have no fees listed in the Payouts Report and will instead show a separate summarized EBT fee in the Payouts Report once a month.

App Version

EBT is ONLY supported by App Version 1.256 and greater.

Payout Schedule

Funds from EBT transactions will be paid out as a separate deposit from the other transactions they process through us. EBT sales should be deposited within 24-48 hours depending on the State the merchant is operating out of and the bank used.

The payout descriptor that should appear on their bank statement is ‚ÄòCNDT/GOEBTIOP‚Äô.

EBT Food

Recipients can use EBT Food benefits to buy eligible food items at authorized retailers, including grocery stores, supermarkets, and farmers markets. Eligible food items typically include fruits, vegetables, meats, dairy products, bread, cereals, and other staple foods.

EBT Cash

EBT Cash benefit provide financial assistance to low-income individuals and families for various needs beyond food purchases.

Recipients can use EBT Cash benefits to withdraw cash from ATMs or make purchases at retailers that accept EBT cards for non-food items. Non-food items may include clothing, household supplies, personal care items, and other necessities.

Onboarding EBT-Eligible Merchants

  1. We have partnered with a company called CDE solutions to enable EBT for our merchants. To onboard a new merchant accepting EBT payments, the Onboarder/CSM should have the merchant complete the onboarding application and get approved.
  1. Once that has happened, the Onboarder/CSM should collect the following information and Slack it to Charles Winfree or Justin Harshbarger who will work with CDE to get it approved.
    1. Legal Name
    1. Address
    1. Phone
    1. Owner
    1. Owner Email
    1. Business type
    1. EIN
    1. MCC
    1. PartnerID (our MID)
  1. The Onboarder/CSM will get an response back from whoever they Slacked with the CDE account number. This should be entered on the Profile page in the Payment Portal. Once that‚Äôs done, the merchant can start accepting transactions on their terminal.
üí°Note: This is planned to be supported automatically in future iterations through the onboarding application rather than being sent manually. This process through Slack is meant to be a stop-gap in the meantime.

Accepting EBT Transactions

Consumers making purchases with EBT can choose to pay with mixed payment (Credit/Debit/EBT Cash/EBT Food), or explicitly with EBT Cash or EBT food.

Mixed Payment

https://prod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/a2eac450-ca50-4632-b656-7d30a3a195b1/28de5771-d9b4-4b32-8b3d-a31ee9ec2aa2/EBT_mixed_food_type.mp4

The mixed payment allows the user to select the which EBT method (Cash or Food) they would like to use and then and pay the remainder with credit or debit. This will be the most commonly used scenario. With this method, the consumer will be prompted to pay with EBT first, complete the transaction, then they will see another prompt on the terminal to pay any remainder with credit/debit.

Each EBT transaction will prompt for a pin, similar to entering a pin while using a debit card.

üí°Note: If the merchant is using the P5 for receipt printing and it has not been enabled, see here. Otherwise, they can use their existing terminal.

EBT Food / Cash

https://prod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/a2eac450-ca50-4632-b656-7d30a3a195b1/f99a9781-ac92-4268-a456-d8e272ac15fb/EBT_cash.mp4

Paying the full total with EBT Food or Cash works similarly to the mixed flow with the only difference being that it will not prompt for a remaining balance.

EBT Balance

At the end of an EBT transaction, a prompt will appear showing their current EBT Balance and asking if they would like to print a receipt with it. The consumer may want to keep this so they can see how much remaining they have.
summary: The documentation outlines the Electronic Benefit Transfer (EBT) system, which allows government welfare recipients to access benefits electronically via a card similar to a credit or debit card. EBT transactions can be processed at authorized retailers using a compatible point-of-sale system, with two main components: EBT Food for purchasing eligible food items and EBT Cash for withdrawing funds or buying non-food items. The document also details the onboarding process for EBT-eligible merchants, pricing structures, transaction reporting, and the requirement for the P5 Terminal and specific app versions to support EBT transactions.

title: Contactless Payment
content:
Contactless Payment

Contactless Payment

Last edited time@July 23, 2024 10:59 AM

Summary:

Contactless payments are a method in which shoppers may make a purchase without a physical card present. Accepting more payments methods has statistically been shown to increase revenue since shoppers have more ways to pay. Contactless transactions allow a person to tap their phone, watch, or other device to the terminal and use its NFC technology to wirelessly accept the payment. Most commonly this is used by digital wallets like ApplePay and GooglePay.

Availability

Contactless Payment is available on all brands, no additional development is required for this feature.

Processor

BrandAvailable
Adyen‚úÖ
Stripe‚úÖ

App Version

All App versions support Contactless payments.

Instructions For Use

Shoppers must press and hold the card with ‚Äúthe contactless logo‚Äù on it or a phone/watch with the payment app of choice opened on the terminal for approximately 5 seconds (or until a beep is heard indicating completion) when prompted. The screen will briefly show a loading bar indicating when to remove card or phone/watch.

üí°NOTE: The reason contactless payments sometimes fail is because shoppers think they can just briefly tap it and be done rather than tap and hold.

Additional information

  • Most contactless payments have transaction limits, which can vary by country, card issuer, and payment network. Generally the transaction limit is $100 - $250.
